title: Position of the ball in a vertical motion
description: Write a function `distance` that returns a list of y values calculated using the formula: y(t) = v0*t - 0.5*g*t^2, for n values of t ranging from t_start to t_end. Use keyword arguments v0=6.0 and g=9.81.
hints: Use a for loop to generate n values of t between t_start and t_end.
Apply the formula for each t and store the result in a list.
Return the list of y values.
